wikitext.*:
'''NEN''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "water".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, p. 52 (form appearing as "√NEN")</ref><ref>{{PE|Eldarin}}, p. 167 (form appearing as "√NĒN", with an added [[Wikipedia:Breve|breve]] to "Ē")</ref><ref name=Ety>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 376 (the root, appearing as "NEN-", is given no signification, but yields equivalent derivatives)</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Common Eldarin]]: ''nendā'' ("watery, wet")<ref>{{VT|46a}}, p. 3</ref>

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[nén|nēn]]'' ("water");<ref name=PE17/> ''[[nenya]]'' ("wet");<ref name=PE17/> ''[[nende]]'';<ref name=PE17/><ref name=Ety/> ''nelle'' ("brook")<ref name=Ety/>
*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[nîn]]'' ("wet"); ''[[nen|nĕn]]'' ("water, lake")<ref name=PE17/>
*[[Noldorin]]: ''[[nen]]''; ''nend, nenn'' ("watery")<ref name=Ety/>

==Other versions of the Legendarium==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root NENE, given the signification "flow?".<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>
